channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Printer in alleyway between London Road and Upper Park Street, 15th February
item.description:
There’s a printer that has been dumped in the alleyway next to Cheltenham Motor Club.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 134 London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red lights out, 15th February
item.description:
There are a few red light not working when coming off the bypass
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe depression in Lane 1 ( LH wheel track ), 15th February
item.description:
Severe depression approx 1.5m diameter, about 50m before J11A exit slip begins, directly inline with NS wheel track. Gives a nasty thud in an HGV so way worse in a car / van

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Pothole Areas > 1-2 metre sections, 15th February
item.description:
In many areas of Eldon Rd and Beechurst Avenue the road is breaking up, some drains have traffic erosion, which could lead to serious cyclist accidents and vehicle tyre damage etc. Some of the recent pothole repairs have been done with no thought to quality and they barely last a year. Proper maintenance or replacement works are urgently needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Eldon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shockingly Dangerous Pavements, 15th February
item.description:
The pavements on Eldon Rd & Beechurst Avenue are broken in many places. This once picturesque street/area is littered with trip hazards which could cause major broken bones and possible death. A particular hazard to toddlers and the elderly. The roads are also in a very poor condition.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 26 Eldon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole In road, 15th February
item.description:
Pothole in road on Charlton Abbots road just past left turn to Charlton Abbots village heading East up Charlton Abbots hill. Added photos to assist location and photographic evidence, Pothole is damaging vehicle wheels and suspension

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in road, 15th February
item.description:
Pothole at foot of Charlton Abbots hill - previously reported but apparently whoever came out couldn’t see a large hole in the road which is damaging cars and very dangerous to cyclists Added photos to this report to assist identification and photographic evidence

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Light is not working, 15th February
item.description:
Lamp post Number 20 in Ryeworth Road; Charlton Kings not working. This is in a spot where there are not houses facing the road, there is an uneven pavement surface and is adjacent to a bend in the road on an incline. This makes for hazardous waling conditions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 124 Ryeworth Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Eastbound road is totally covered in mud - lethal., 15th February
item.description:
The eastbound carriageway is covered in thick mud - dangerous on 4 wheels, lethal on 2.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Coberley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes leaving the roundabout, 15th February
item.description:
Several on the Road

item.title: Sunken tarmac, 15th February
item.description:
Sunken tarmac (previous roadworks) by the roundabout central pedestrian refuge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 Fox Close, Abbeymead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unclear road markings and signs, 14th February
item.description:
As you approach from Bishops Cleeve towards the racecourse roundabout along the Evesham Road (Racecourse on your left). There needs to be more road signs and road markings as it is unclear of what lane goes where. The left lane is marked as Left turn only which tells me that is taking you into the racecourse. The right lane is marked right and straight on which tells me this is for all other traffic as well as New Barn Lane (B4075). But 99% of the traffic use the left hand lane even though it is marked left only (Racecourse)to go down New Barn Lane which then blocks the traffic in the right(correct) lane. The left lane needs to be marked for racecourse only or more signs on approach plus better road paint to tell you what lane is for where. At present I am surprised there hasn't been more accidents due to the difficult to understand signs and markings. Please can this be sorted asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Evesham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes, 13th February
item.description:
The section of Springbank Way from Carlyle Grove up to the junction with Hesters Way has a number of ever increasingly large potholes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11a Springbank Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tip, 13th February
item.description:
This fly tip was reported well over a week ago and as predicted the polystyrene in the tip has blown around - notably down the Cotswold Way track. Please can this be collected as soon as possible to prevent further spread and problems.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Beechfield House Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish Bags left after recent Bin Emptying, 13th February
item.description:
The location is the Cleeve Commons Pylons Car park. The bins were emptied as normal - some other bags left beside the bins were collected as well. However, a bag behind one of the bins was left and now the local wildlife have torn out the bottom with the danger the rubbish will be blown onto the common if the wind direction changes. Please can this be cleared up as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Mod Communication Site Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipped Matress and other rubbish at the Location, 13th February
item.description:
The location is the Pylons Car Park at the end of the Cleeve Common Road. The material has been dumped just behind the gate at the side of the pylons site. Please can it be removed as this is an important part of the AONB

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Mod Communication Site Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unclear road markings, 12th February
item.description:
Approaching the racecourse roundabout along Evesham Rd with the racecourse on the left additional road markings/lane signage is needed. The left lane is marked as left turn only which suggests it is only for use taking the racecourse exit. The right lane is marked as ahead & right which suggests it’s for traffic taking all other exits including new barn lane. The majority of traffic taking the new barn lane exit uses the left lane meaning the block the traffic in the correct right hand lane. Left lane needs to be marked racecourse only or an additional sign on approach to the roundabout is needed confirming which lane is for which exits. The current ambiguous road markings/lack of lane signage are highly likely to cause a serious accident if they’re not clarified.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Evesham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bentham Lane sign, 12th February
item.description:
The Betham Lane sign has again been knocked by a vehicle and is pointing along the A46 to Cheltenham. Lorries are turning to Little Shurdington and then trying to use Dark Lane and getting stuck The sign needs setting back from the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elm Cottage Shurdington Road, Bentham
Report on FixMyStreet
